comment: Prof. Lindsay is not the best at lecturing. First, he is very soft-spoken. Even if the whole class agrees we are confused, he will not re-explain and tells us that we can learn it ourselves. He speaks bluntly and is mildly rude. Didnt drop his class so I wasnt here another semester, but I 100% would have. HW and quizzes are easy, still not worth it

If you want an easy A & not have to learn anything take him. 1 group project that lasts the entire semester & he helps you with it. All quizzes, hw, & tests are online so you can use your notes. He even lets you use notes on the final. My class was only on Mondays 8-1045 pm but it generally only lasted until 9 or @ way latest 930.

Most of the class was through ConnectMath, if you sit in the back of the class you probably will not hear a thing he says. His lectures are iffy, I never really payed attention to them. You can teach yourself the course using ConnectMath examples and guides. Easy A.

Professor Lindsay is okay. Lectures are pretty boring, but he only does it for about an hour or so. He gives you the rest of the time to ask questions and work on your group projects. Everything is online; homework, quizzes, and tests. Should be pretty straightforward and easy if you put forth effort.

Not a very good professor but if you ask for help on the project he helps you and will make sure it's good when its time to turn it in. Class was an easy A because everything was online through connect math. Final was open book. Do the homework and i promise you,ll come out with an A or B in the class.

He is extremely boring and is very confusing. We have online quizzes and online tests which make the class very passable. There is a group porject you work on the entire semester and he is not helpful with the instructions or anything on it. I would not take again

There was one group project the entire semester that covered every bit of material we learned. He is an extremely nice and understanding professor, but when he teaches, I have no idea what he's saying. Math has always been something I could pick up on easily, but his thought processes were so jumbled; it was very hard to follow.

Is obviously passionate about math, but all over the place as a teacher. Good man, but bad teacher, you'll pretty much have to do all self-study. All homework, tests, and quizzes are online. Unlimited attempts on HW, 2 tries per quiz.  Pro-calculator use. Big mandatory group project due at the end of the semester.
